min_audio_length.description: The minimum length of an audio sample in seconds. Audio shorter than this will be ignored during preprocessing.
min_audio_length.title: Min Audio Length

max_audio_length.description: The maximum length of an audio sample in seconds. Audio longer than this will be ignored during preprocessing. Increasing the max_audio_length will result in larger memory usage. If you are running out of memory, consider lowering the max_audio_length.
max_audio_length.title: Max Audio Length

max_wav_value.description: Advanced. The maximum value allowed to be in your wav files. For 16-bit audio, this should be (2**16)/2 - 1.
max_wav_value.title: Max Wav Value

input_sampling_rate.description: The sampling rate describes the number of samples per second of audio. The 'input_sampling_rate' is with respect to your vocoder, or spec-to-wav model. This means that the spectrograms predicted by your text-to-spec model will also be calculated from audio at this sampling rate. If you change this value, your audio will automatically be re-sampled during preprocessing.
input_sampling_rate.title: Input Sampling Rate

output_sampling_rate.description: Advanced. The sampling rate describes the number of samples per second of audio. The 'output_sampling_rate' is with respect to your vocoder, or spec-to-wav model. This means that the wav files generated by your vocoder or spec-to-wav model will be at this sampling rate. If you change this value, you will also need to change the upsample rates in your vocoder. Your audio will automatically be re-sampled during preprocessing.
output_sampling_rate.title: Output Sampling Rate

alignment_sampling_rate.description: Advanced. The sampling rate describes the number of samples per second of audio. The 'alignment_sampling_rate' describes the sampling rate used when training an alignment model. If you change this value, your audio will automatically be re-sampled during preprocessing.
alignment_sampling_rate.title: Alignment Sampling Rate

target_bit_depth.description: Advanced. This is the bit depth of each sample in your audio files.
target_bit_depth.title: Target Bit Depth

n_fft.description: Advanced. This is the number of bins used by the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT).
n_fft.title: FFT Size

fft_window_size.description: Advanced. This is the window size used by the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT).
fft_window_size.title: FFT Window Size

fft_hop_size.description: Advanced. This is the hop size for calculating the Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT) which calculates a sequence of spectrograms from a single audio file. Another way of putting it is that the hop size is equal to the amount of non-intersecting samples from the audio in each spectrogram.
fft_hop_size.title: FFT Hop Size

f_min.description: Advanced. This is the minimum frequency for the lowest frequency bin when calculating the spectrogram.
f_min.title: Minimum Frequency

f_max.description: Advanced. This is the maximum frequency for the highest frequency bin when calculating the spectrogram.
f_max.title: Maximum Frequency

n_mels.description: Advanced. This is the number of filters in the Mel-scale spaced filterbank.
n_mels.title: Number of Mel bins

spec_type.description: Advanced. Defines how to calculate the spectrogram. 'mel' uses the TorchAudio implementation for a Mel spectrogram. 'mel-librosa' uses Librosa's implementation. 'linear' calculates a non-Mel linear spectrogram and 'raw' calculates a complex-valued spectrogram. 'linear' and 'raw' are not currently supported by EveryVoice. We recommend using 'mel-librosa'.
spec_type.title: Spec Type

vocoder_segment_size.description: Advanced. The vocoder, or spec-to-wav model is trained by sampling random fixed-size sections of the audio. This value specifies the number of samples in those sections.
vocoder_segment_size.title: Vocoder Segment Size

lstm_dim.description: The number of dimensions in the LSTM layers.
lstm_dim.title: Lstm Dim

conv_dim.description: The number of dimensions in the convolutional layers.
conv_dim.title: Conv Dim

batch_size.description: The number of samples to include in each batch when training. If you are running out of memory, consider lowering your batch_size.
batch_size.title: Batch Size

save_top_k_ckpts.description: The number of checkpoints to save.
save_top_k_ckpts.title: Save Top K Ckpts

ckpt_steps.description: The interval (in steps) for saving a checkpoint. By default checkpoints are saved every epoch using the 'ckpt_epochs' hyperparameter
ckpt_steps.title: Ckpt Steps

ckpt_epochs.description: The interval (in epochs) for saving a checkpoint. You can also save checkpoints after n steps by using 'ckpt_steps'
ckpt_epochs.title: Ckpt Epochs

max_epochs.description: Stop training after this many epochs
max_epochs.title: Max Epochs

max_steps.description: Stop training after this many steps
max_steps.title: Max Steps

finetune_checkpoint.description: Automatically resume training from a checkpoint loaded from this path.
finetune_checkpoint.title: Finetune Checkpoint

training_filelist.description: The path to a filelist containing samples belonging to your training set.
training_filelist.title: Training Filelist

validation_filelist.description: The path to a filelist containing samples belonging to your validation set.
validation_filelist.title: Validation Filelist

filelist_loader.description: Advanced. The function to use to load the filelist.
filelist_loader.title: Filelist Loader

val_data_workers.description: The number of CPU workers to use when loading data during validation.
val_data_workers.title: Val Data Workers

train_data_workers.description: The number of CPU workers to use when loading data during training.
train_data_workers.title: Train Data Workers

plot_steps.description: The maximum number of steps to plot
plot_steps.title: Plot Steps

extraction_method.description: The alignment extraction algorithm to use. 'beam' will be quicker but possibly less accurate than 'dijkstra'

label.description: A label for the source of data
label.title: Label

data_dir.description: The path to the directory with your audio files.
data_dir.title: Data Dir

filelist.description: The path to your dataset's filelist.
filelist.title: Filelist

filelist_loader.description: Advanced. The file-loader function to use to load your dataset's filelist.
filelist_loader.title: Filelist Loader

sox_effects.description: Advanced. A list of SoX effects to apply to your audio prior to preprocessing. Run python -c 'import torchaudio; print(torchaudio.sox_effects.effect_names())' to see a list of supported effects.
sox_effects.title: Sox Effects

LoggerConfig.description:
The logger configures all the information needed for where to store your experiment's logs and checkpoints.
The structure of your logs will then be:
<name> / <version> / <sub_dir>
<sub_dir> will be generated by calling <sub_dir_callable> each time the LoggerConfig is constructed.

name.description: The name of the experiment. The structure of your logs will be <name> / <version> / <sub_dir>.
name.title: Experiment Name

save_dir.description: The directory to save your checkpoints and logs to.
save_dir.title: Save Dir

sub_dir_callable.description: The function that generates a string to call your runs - by default this is a timestamp. The structure of your logs will be <name> / <version> / <sub_dir> where <sub_dir> is a timestamp.
sub_dir_callable.title: Sub Dir Callable

version.description: The version of your experiment. The structure of your logs will be <name> / <version> / <sub_dir>.
version.title: Version

LoggerConfig.title: LoggerConfig

train_split.description: The amount of the dataset to use for training. The rest will be used as validation. Hold some of the validation set out for a test set if you are performing experiments.
train_split.title: Train Split

dataset_split_seed.description: The seed to use when splitting the dataset into train and validation sets.
dataset_split_seed.title: Dataset Split Seed

save_dir.description: The directory to save preprocessed files to.
save_dir.title: Save Dir

path_to_audio_config_file.description: The path to an audio configuration file.
path_to_audio_config_file.title: Path To Audio Config File

silence.description: The symbol(s) used to indicate silence.
silence.title: Silence

pad.description: The symbol used to indicate padding. Batches are length-normalized by adding this padding character so that each utterance in the batch is the same length.
pad.title: Pad

path_to_training_config_file.title: Path To Training Config File
